bboxes.raw_text:
civil rights is a theme. a
topic, a religion which engulfs
nearly every educated Negro in
America. A century after the
Emancipation Proclamation. .
the plight of the Negro is tragic,
disillusioning. almost pathetic.
In no field in America has he
reached his potential" states
Simeon Booker in his new book
about the civil rights revolution,
"Black Mans America" which
Prentice-Hall will publish on
June lst.


Booker, one of the nations
leading Negro journalists and
prize-winning chief Washington
correspondent for Americas
largest-circulation Negro mag
azines. EBONY and JET, has

had long-term firsthand view of
the Negroes struggle to become
a first-class citizen. AS a re-
porter travelling with the Free
dom Riders, he was caught up in
the violence that met the buses
as they ventured into Alabama.
AS White House reporter, Book
er has been close observer of
the presidential attitude towards
integration through three admin
istrations Eisenhower s, Ken
nedys, and now Lyndon john
sons AS an influential columnist
whose voice is heard throughout
the Negro community. Booker en-
joys the confidence and respect
of noted leaders of the anti-seg-
regation movement.

In the good Of summertime
when water sports are at their
peak, the Sentry Safety Council
Of the Sentry Insurance COM
panies offers these safety tips:
Before showing off, check
weather reports, storm sig
nails, your gasoline supply.
. Familiarize yourself with wat
ers in which you plan to go.
. In most waters you are re-
quired by law to have a Coast
Guard approved lifesaving de-
vice for each person aboard.
. Always carry a first aid kit,
flashlight, oars, spare parts
like shear pins, spark plugs.
. Bilge ventilation is important.
Carburetors on inboards
should have flame arresters,
built-in fuel tanks should be
vented.


. When fueling, stop all engines,
fans, other devices liable to
produce sparks. Do not smoke
when refueling. Have fire ex-
tinguisher available.

Overlooking is a leading cause


of mishaps, follow manufac-


turer's capacity limits.
. Don't be "hot-rudder," the


boating equivalent of a hot


rodder, warns the Sentry Safe


ty Council. Use common sense.
. Obey boating traffic laws.
. Observe all buoys-they mark
: danger or safe channels.
. Alcohol and boating don't mix.
. Don't be a litterbug; save gar


bage for shore disposal.
. Make sure your registration


certificate is on board, your


boat is adequately insured.
. Never swim during electrical


storms, alone or when you are


tired, overheated; wait at least


an hour after eating.
. Every swimmer should under


stand rescue methods.


Finally, the Sentry Safety
Council says little precaution
ahead of time can make first aid
measures unnecessary later.

LOS ANGELES Whitney M.
Young, Jr., executive director of
the National Urban League. told
the DIST annual forum of the
National Conference on Social
Welfare that the high costs of
relief should be reduced.


He told the audience that cit
les can dramatically reduce the
number Of Negroes on public aid
rolls by aggressive attack on
racial barriers in employment,
housing. education, health and
welfare.

Urban League Head
Says Cities Must
End Segregation

Mrs. c. O. Greenfield Syb Dryer receives the Principals Award
OCreeneld Tribune
Award.


Second Mary Serpa accepts Careers
Elizabeth eupe Mrs. Gertrude Vaughn physical education teacher
surprise bouquet from DR.. c. O. Greenfield for her
standing achievements winning
and her volunteer work with her girs Mrs. James Billion
presents diplomas.
